description: Restructure the system_prompt section to center on workflow design as the core discipline

key_decisions.decision: Center the skill on workflow design as the core discipline
key_decisions.rationale: The workflow IS the product. Purpose/knowledge/goal/background are context. Workflow is what directs model behavior.

key_decisions.decision: Use steps for single-completion, phases for multi-turn
key_decisions.rationale: Steps = internal reasoning scaffold (thinking window). Phases = external execution flow (tool calls, state updates).
Groups single-completion and multi-turn as patterns. Keeps top level clean: overview, base-template, workflow-design, then patterns/.

key_decisions.decision: workflow-design.md is dense reference; pattern files are application
key_decisions.rationale: workflow-design covers the theory (XML structure, general rules). Pattern files show how to apply those principles for specific use cases (single-completion vs multi-turn).

key_decisions.decision: workflow-design becomes a folder containing patterns
key_decisions.rationale: Keeps workflow design as cohesive unit. Overview, base principles, then patterns (single-completion, multi-turn) inside.

key_decisions.decision: Single-completion vs Multi-turn is the fundamental split; techniques within multi-turn
key_decisions.rationale: Split is based on execution model (thinking window vs external state). Iterative-loop and parallel-agents are techniques within multi-turn, not separate types.

high_level: Reframe the skill around workflow design as the central discipline
Make learning path clear: overview → base template → workflow design → pattern-specific
mid_level: 20-workflow-design/10-base.md: Core principles for all workflows (dense reference)
